attributes.comment:
In regards to USCIS-2006-0044, I strongly urge you to reconsider raising the fees
associated with international adoption. The entire international adoption process
is extremely expensive, and often takes a couple of years to complete. Because
of very strict and specific rules set by the foreign countries, adoptive families often
have to re-file their paperwork to ensure it is current enough to meet those
requirements. For example, Vietnam will not accept documents that are over 6
months old. I am currently on the waiting list for a child from Vietnam, and my
paperwork will expire long before I am matched with a child. USCIS will already
get at least double money from me because of these guidelines that will require
me to re-file my paperwork. I cannot see any reason why the fees need to be
increased, especially by so much. Adoptive families already have to go through
so much to have an opportunity to add a child to their lives. Please do not make
the journey any more difficult than it already is. Thank you.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Tiffany N. Feret
